official_title: Professor of Mathematics, NYU Shanghai; Global Network Professor, NYU
bio:
Vladas Sidoravicius comes to us from the Institute of Pure and Applied Mathematics, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.  He is especially well known for his work on discrete probability, statistical mechanics, percolation theory, random media, and particle systems. He is a longstanding research partner with colleagues at NYU’s Courant Institute of Mathematics.

Research Interests

  • Probability Theory
  • Ergodic Theory
  • Statistical Physics

Recent Publications

  • Rolla, L.; Sidoravicius, V.; Stability of a Server with Greedy Strategy on the Circle. arXiv:1112.2389, submitted, 2012.
  • Hilario, M.: Sidoravicius, V.: Teixeira, A.; Cylinders' percolation in three dimensions. arXiv:1202.1684, submitted to JAMS, 2013.
  • Damron, M.; Newman, C.M.; Sidoravicius, V.; Absence of site percolation at criticality in Z^2 x {0,1}. arXiv:1211.4138, submitted to Ann. of Probability, 2012.

Education

  • PhD, Mathematics and Informatics, Moscow State University and Institute of Mathematics and Informatics, Vilnius, 1990
  • MA, Mathematics, University of Vilnius, 1986
